metadata.titleEn: Modeling results of leaf area index in the middle and lower Heihe River Basin at the north of Qilian Mountains (2001-2015)
metadata.description: The dataset of leaf area index in the middle and lower Heihe River Basin at the north of Qilian Mountains (2001-2015) is stimulated by the Hydrological-Ecological Integrated watershed Flow Model (HEIFLOW). HEIFLOW is a three-dimensional distributed eco-hydrological coupling model, integrating the Precipitation-Runoff Modeling System (PRMS) with the Modular Groundwater Flow Model (MODFLOW) and several ecological modules, which can completely describe the hydrological cycle and vegetation ecological process of the basin. For the modeling details of generating this data, please refer to Han et al. (2021), and for the technical details of HEIFLOW  model, please refer to Han et al. (2021), Tian et al. (2018), and sun et al. (2018)

Verification.Question: Does the ecological hydrological coupling model HEIFLOW utilize a combination of surface water and groundwater models to simulate leaf area index data?

Quantification.Question: How many years of leaf area index data have been simulated using the HEIFLOW model in the Heihe River Basin?

Causal Antecedent.Question: What causes lead researchers to choose the HEIFLOW model for simulating leaf area index in the Qilian Mountains region between 2001 and 2015?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: Researchers chose the HEIFLOW model for simulating the leaf area index in the Qilian Mountains region because it is a comprehensive three-dimensional distributed eco-hydrological model that integrates a surface water model (PRMS), a groundwater model (MODFLOW), and several ecological modules. This allows for a more complete description of watershed water cycles and vegetation ecological processes, which is essential for accurately simulating the leaf area index in complex environments like the Qilian Mountains.

Goal Orientation.Question: What are the objectives of using an eco-hydrological coupling model like HEIFLOW for simulating monthly leaf area index in river basins?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The goal of using the HEIFLOW model is to comprehensively describe the water cycle and vegetation ecological processes in the basin. This includes integrating surface water and groundwater models with ecological modules to simulate interactions between hydrology and vegetation accurately, as demonstrated in the 2001-2015 data for the Heihe River Basin in the northern Qilian Mountains.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the steps involved in using ecological hydrological coupling models like HEIFLOW to simulate monthly leaf area index data in a watershed, and what are some challenges that might arise during the modeling and data collection process?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The process involves setting up the HEIFLOW model, which is a three-dimensional distributed ecological hydrological simulation model composed of a surface water model (PRMS), a groundwater model (MODFLOW), and several ecological modules. These components work together to comprehensively describe the watershed water cycle and vegetation ecological processes. The challenges may include ensuring accurate calibration of the model parameters, integrating diverse data sources effectively, and managing the computational complexity associated with the three-dimensional simulations. For detailed technical guidance and challenges, references such as Han et al. (2021), Tian et al. (2018), and Sun et al. (2018) can be consulted.
